cookingTips: Cut broccoli florets uniformly so they roast evenly and achieve consistent charring on the edges within the 35-minute timeframe.
Spread the butter on the hot pan before adding broccoli to create a non-stick surface and enhance browning through the Maillard reaction.
Mix the teriyaki and Worcestershire sauces together before drizzling to ensure even distribution across all florets.
Check the broccoli every 10-15 minutes and stir gently to prevent over-charring on one side while ensuring all pieces get crispy edges.
Save broccoli stems for vegetable stock or peel and roast separately as they take longer to soften than florets.
